content: Award for distinguished service in Singaporean army or police The **Pingat Kehormatan** (English: **Medal of Honour**) is a Singaporean [national honour](/wiki/Singaporean_orders_and_decorations) instituted in 1970. It is a medal awarded to any member of the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces) or the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force) who has performed "*any act or series of acts constituting distinguished conduct in active service in the field"*. In special circumstances, it may also be awarded to any person who performed an act which constitute as distinguished conduct while engaged active field service. The medal may be [awarded posthumously](/wiki/Posthumous_award). However, it has never been awarded since its inception. - Singapore Prime Minister's Office - The Medal of Honour This Singapore-related article is a stub.
